Package Controllers

Class EditAppointmentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controllers.EditAppointmentController
  • public class EditAppointmentController
extends java.lang.Object
    Edit appointment view that loads the selected appointment from the main appointments page and populates all inputs for that selected appointment. Once the user hits save, all inputs are run through validation and any updates saved for that appointment.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static java.lang.String convertTimeToAMPM​(java.time.LocalTime time)
      This converts the LocalTime object selected in the start/end combo boxes to 12hr am/pm formats for better readability for the user.
      private void disableDaysBeforeToday()
      Disables days in date picker before current date as an extra layer of validation for appointments.
      private void formatTimes()
      Formats LocalTime cells to display as 12hr time format.
      private void initialize()
      Initializes and populates all inputs with selected appointment information.
      private void setButtonActions()
      Grabs user inputs, validates inputs with InputValidation.areAppointmentInputsValid(int, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String, java.time.LocalDate, java.time.LocalTime, java.time.LocalTime), which also checks if appointment date and times are within business hours and do not conflict with other customer appointments, before saving the new appointment to the database and local cache, and finally navigating the user back to the main appointments view with a success alert.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • timesCellFactory

        javafx.util.Callback<javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.time.LocalTime>,​javafx.scene.control.ListCell<java.time.LocalTime>> timesCellFactory
        Callback to reformat combobox selection for start/end. Does NOT use lambda for iteration since only single object * that we need to convert.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditAppointmentController

        public EditAppointmentController()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initializes and populates all inputs with selected appointment information. Set actions for all buttons and listeners.

      • setButtonActions

        private void setButtonActions()
        Grabs user inputs, validates inputs with InputValidation.areAppointmentInputsValid(int, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String, java.time.LocalDate, java.time.LocalTime, java.time.LocalTime), which also checks if appointment date and times are within business hours and do not conflict with other customer appointments, before saving the new appointment to the database and local cache, and finally navigating the user back to the main appointments view with a success alert.

      • disableDaysBeforeToday

        private void disableDaysBeforeToday()
        Disables days in date picker before current date as an extra layer of validation for appointments. Uses lambda * for better iteration through cells with updateItem function to disable.

      • formatTimes

        private void formatTimes()
        Formats LocalTime cells to display as 12hr time format. Lambda is used for iterating through list cells to perform updateItem function more efficiently.

      • convertTimeToAMPM

        public static java.lang.String convertTimeToAMPM​(java.time.LocalTime time)
                                          throws java.text.ParseException
        This converts the LocalTime object selected in the start/end combo boxes to 12hr am/pm formats for better readability for the user.
        Parameters:
        time - time selection from start/end combo boxes
        Returns:
        time formatted to 12hr am/pm format
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - in case LocalTime object can't be converted to new format
